text: Marie Braemer-Skowronek (9 December 1990) is a German Paralympic athlete competing in F34 classification throwing events. Braemer-Skowronek represented Germany at the 2012 Summer Paralympic Games in London, entering the javelin throw and the shot put. She finished tenth in the shot and in the javelin, which stretched over four classifications, she threw a distance of 20.43 metres to win the silver medal. As well as Paralympic success, Braemer- Skowronek won a bronze medal at the 2013 IPC Athletics World Championships in the javelin. == References == Category:Paralympic silver medalists for Germany Category:Paralympic athletes of Germany Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2012 Summer Paralympics Category:German female javelin throwers Category:German female shot putters Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:Medalists at the 2012 Summer Paralympics Category:People from Wolmirstedt Category:Paralympic medalists in athletics (track and field)
title: Marie Braemer-Skowronek
